paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on a somatic BRCA2 pathogenic variant from a case report involving a patient with metastatic lung adenocarcinoma.

individual_records.phenotype_details: metastatic lung adenocarcinoma with a somatic BRCA2 pathogenic variant
individual_records.evidence_sentence: In May 2020, next-generation sequencing (NGS) (Oncomine Comprehensive Assay v3) was conducted on the lung biopsy, which revealed a somatic BRCA2 c.1411G > T (p.Glu471Ter) pathogenic variant.

functional_data.summary: The variant is predicted to result in an amino acid substitution of glutamic acid with a stop codon, causing a nonsense variant that leads to loss of normal protein function.

variants.segregation_data: Not applicable; only one patient reported.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence for pathogenicity based on loss-of-function effects.
variants.additional_notes: The patient had a germline BRCA2 wild type.
key_quotes: Loss-of-function variants in BRCA2 are known to be pathogenic.
The absence of BRCA2 leads to defective DNA double-strand break repair by homologous recombination.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the BRCA2 variant was extracted from the main text.
